text: When we travel, we look for a place full of culture
Art, entertainment Delicious food! , and why not?
If you visit the old continent, you will get all this in every country.
However, Spain has always been one of the favorite tourist places
Not only in Europe
But also all over the world!
The unique Spanish gastronomy, its sunny weather, and its diverse architecture
Are some of the reasons why this country attracts thousands of visitors every month!
The most visited cities are Madrid and Barcelona, but Spain has more to offer!
Would you like to get to know this destination?
Here are ten places you must visit during your visit to Spain!
No. 1 Basilica of the Sagrada Familia-Barcelona
Located in Barcelona, La Sagrada Familia is one of the most famous basilicas in the world.
This place is cataloged as one of the essentials to see in Spain.
Its construction began more than 135 years ago
And was designed by the Spanish architect Gaudi.
La Sagrada Familia is under construction yet, and it is estimated to be ready in 2026.
But even so, it is a very famous tourist attraction in Spain and Europe.
Its facade is very modern, its interior looks like a stone forest, and it has 18 towers!
12 for each apostle, 4 for the evangelists, one for Mary, and one for Jesus!
So far, only eight are in operation today.
If you want to have a spectacular view of Barcelona
You can climb one of the towers that are open to the public.
It will be worth it!
No. 2 Park Güel-Barcelona.
Barcelona also offers you one of the most beautiful parks in the world!
Designed by Antonio Gaudi, there it is The Park Güel.
This park surprises all its visitors with its sculptures, fountains, and buildings.
They are all inspired by the shapes of nature!
It's like being in a fairy tale!
In the Plaza de la Naturaleza, there is an undulating bench on one of its sides
Full of beautiful mosaics and incredible views of the entire city.
The Dragon Staircase is the most famous of the park.
As its name indicates, it is a large staircase with a fountain and a beautiful dragon sculpture.
Other beautiful sites of the park that you can't miss are the Hypostyle Hall
The House of the Guardian, the Portico of the Laundress, and the Gardens of Austria.
No. 3 The Alhambra-Granada
Now in the south, in Granada, there are also amazing things to see!
The medieval complex of Granada is another favorite destination for travelers.
Its construction began in 666 A.D.
And today, it represents all the splendor and power of the Nasrid dynasty
That ruled Spain centuries ago!
Currently, the Alhambra Palace is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
It was declared back in 1984.
Its buildings and gardens will leave you speechless!
They are a spectacle for your eyes!
The palace grounds are made up of rectangular courtyards adorned with fountains
And flowers, among which is The Courtyard of the Lions.
Also, The Nasrid palaces that make up the building are an example of eastern architecture.
Other points of interest are the Alcazaba,
Some of the oldest buildings of the Alhambra.
And the Torre de la Vela has become one of the most visited places
for its spectacular view of Granada
The Albaycín, and the Sierra Nevada.
No.  4 The Puerta del Sol-Madrid
In the heart of Spain and the center of Madrid, you will find the Puerta del Sol!
One of the most famous plazas in Spain.
Did you know that several main and commercial streets of the city
Pass or end at this point?
Here is the "kilometer zero" from which all the country's radial roads start.
The Puerta del Sol also houses the famous statue of El Oso y el Madroño built-in 1967.
In the plaza, you can also find the clock of the post office
Every New Year's Eve, the chimes ring out
and visitors and locals gather to welcome the New Year.
No. 5 Prado Museum-Madrid
If you are an art lover and are passing through Madrid, you cannot miss the Prado Museum.
A place with art and culture! It is considered one of the most famous art galleries in the world.
It has works from all art periods such as Goya, El Greco, Velázquez, Rubens
And El Bosco, among others.
No. 6 The City of Arts and Sciences and the Oceanographic Park - Valencia
Already in Valencia, a good point of interest in this city built-in 1998
And designed by the Spanish architect Calatrava
The city of Arts and Science is a place not-to-miss
Take long and beautiful walks, enjoy the children's museums and play for a while in the parks!
Do not forget to visit the oceanographic, the largest aquarium in Europe!
This place represents the marine ecosystems of the different seas
And oceans of the whole planet.
Undoubtedly, it's an educational and entertaining attraction for the entire family!
No. 7 Cap de Formentor-Mallorca
We move to the Balearic Islands to enjoy the most beautiful sunsets in the Mediterranean
At the Cap de Formentor.
A winding road will take you along 18 kilometers to one of the best panoramic views
You can imagine.
Viewpoints on both sides of the road.
The Sa Crueta, at 232 meters high, is the best to enjoy the views of the islet of Colomer.
Undoubtedly a romantic walk.
No. 8 Cape Finistere - A Coruña.
In Galicia, the north of Spain, you will find Finisterre
Where the end of the world was once believed to be.
The Roman general who led the conquest of Galicia, Decimus Junius Brutus
Believed that the sun ceased to exist here.
The locals say that the Phoenicians practiced sun worship in Finisterre.
Currently, a powerful lighthouse of 17 meters high and visible 32 miles away reigns over the cape
And is the place that pilgrims on the Jacobean route choose to end this spiritual journey.
No. 9 Caminito del Rey-Málaga.
A path of 3 kilometers long, inaugurated in 1921 by King Alfonso XIII
Communicates the two reservoirs.
El Caminito del Rey is one of the most emblematic tourist attractions in Spain
And today it is still popular.
Do you dare to cross it?
The Caminito del Rey has the best view of the Desfiladero de Los Gaitanes
And the Guadalhorce River
Which runs at the foot of the 700-meter deep canyon where the path is.
The route has footbridges, some of them a meter long, hanging from the canyon walls
But don't worry, all of these walkways have been restored!
And handrails have been added to offer visitors better safety during the tour.
No. 10 Aqueduct of Segovia-Segovia
Are you’re a lover of antiquity?
This construction dates back to between the 1st and 2nd century and is one of the oldest!
Considered the most important Roman civil work in the country,
Is the best-preserved Roman Aqueduct in the world.
Want to know more about the Aqueduct?
The Royal Mint of Segovia has an interactive interpretation center
Which you can visit several spots.
Spain has it all, architecture, art, beautiful views, delicious food, and pleasant weather!
That's why it's a perfect choice for traveling alone, as a couple or as a family!
What are you waiting for ?
Let yourself explore the magic that Spain has in each of its cities.
Remember that this country is beautiful from north to south, from east to west.
So, make sure you enjoy them to the fullest.
